purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the data that specifies task methods, that is the method specified for a particular activity. The task method specifications can then be referenced from schedules and in recording activities that have been undertaken.
task_elements may have the following characteristics:

ul.li: A Task method is the combination of something to be achieved and, optionally, a way to achieve it. The same result can be achieved through more than one method;
A Task method can be defined as simple text or as as a processible structure using repeats, sequences and decision points;
A Task method can be associated with pre and post states.

purpose.p: The following are not enabled by directly this module alone but are enabled by modules that use this module:

ul.li: A Task method can be associated with the resources required to do it. The quantity of resource and the probability that it is needed can be specified;
A resource may optionally be linked to specific stages within a task method as well as to the overall task method;
The output from a task method can be specified, with quantities and probabilities of occurrence.

purpose.p: This edition refelcts spliting with . It incorporates modifications to the previous edition listed below.
The following ARM EXPRESS has been modified

ul.li: in a relationship entity - relating must preceed related

purpose.p: The following MIM EXPRESS has been modified

ul.li: USE FROM method_definition_schema moved to task_element_arm.
SUBTYPE_CONSTRAINT restrict_task_method_subtypes FOR task_element moved to task_element_arm

inscope.li: the specification of a task method as a sequence of instructions encoded as text;
the specification of a task method as a structured set of instructions;
the association of pre-conditions to a task method or a stage within a task method;
the association of post-conditions to a task method or a stage within a task method;
the assignment of a task method.

outscope.li: the identification and detailed description of resources required by tasks method;
the history of execution of task methods and the corresponding use of resources;
the association of predicted resource requirements to a task method;
the association of predicted inputs or resources to a task method;
the association of predicted outputs from a task method;
the things to which a task method may be assigned;
the association of task method to the context in which it was generated or is to be applied.

definition.def: the method for a possible or intended activity

uof.name: Task_specification
uof.description:
The Task_specification UoF enables the specification of task methods and task elements. The method to be followed may be specified as a sequence of stages, including advisory stages, as repeating and conditional stages. A task method may invoke another task method as a stage.
A task method may be related to states that it requires or generates.

refdata_subclause.title: Classifications of Task_element
refdata_subclause.p: A may be classified in order to specify its intended interpretation and usage.

refdata_subclause.title: AdvisoryTaskElement
refdata_subclause.p: An AdvisoryTaskElement is one which does not affect the process logic, but is used to provide additional information such as for safety procedures etc.

example.p: The following shows how the Advisory task element would appear in an ISO 10303-21 instance data file.
The following shows how the AdvisoryTaskElement can be represented using an OWL ontology and the related RDF/XML Abbreviated syntax.
